title: How to write a good technical review paper - Quora

response.answer_text: 1. Abstract: Write an abstract of approximately 150 words. Provide a brief summary of the major literature reviewed, the rationale for the review, and conclusions drawn. The abstract should not contain any citation. It only shows what the readers will expect in your paper. You can also include keywords in your abstract. 2. Introduction: The introduction should contain the rationale for why you chose the topic. You should mention why the topic is important. This part will set the base for the rest of your paper. State the thesis in this section. 3. Body: The body should not just be a summary of various literature. Include your analysis and interpretation also in this section. Moreover, you will have to organize your points with the help of sub-headings. 4. Conclusion: Conclusion part is as important as other parts. Your conclusion must connect your thesis and your points. You should arrive at a conclusion based on the discussion in your body part. The conclusion can include suggestions or the significance of your paper in a larger context. 5. References: Report all the works cited in your paper. Make use of standard formatting styles such as APA, MLA or Harvard.

Summarize the paper (1-3 paras). This sounds obvious, but it's critical. It's your way of telling the authors, “No matter what you may think you wrote, this is how it read to me”. That's very useful for the authors to know. Critical evaluation (as long as necessary): Here's where you say what you think about the claims. Your response can run the gamut of abstraction from technical to philosophical. It's possible to disagree with technical details but like the overall direction; conversely, it's possible to like the technical work, but disagree with the directionDetailed comments: Now you focus on local details as much as necessary. Here it's fine to progress through the paper sequentially.
